description:
Really nice people working here. I had not been in for two months, and yet the guy remembered me and remembered my drink.

The espresso they use is quite good. It's a cozy cafe and they make their own fancy chocolates. Highly recommended.
author: E C.

description:
Closed for an undetermined time due to water damage to the building!

Too bad, was excited to try them.
author: Sunil R.

description: Really cute spot for chocolate and coffee. They have these adorable stuffed llamas everywhere and printed on everything including the treats. I got the truffagato with a marshmallow on top. It's truffle with espresso so it was rich, bitter and sweet at the same time. It was actually pretty dark too but a nice mid day pick me up.
author: Jen L.

description: Moon Cake Time!  Socola produces a savory Moon Cake Truffle!  A little salty in the inside with an inner looking eggy looking thingy.  Innovative chocolatiering satisfying the whims of their clientele!  Nice!  Enuf said!
author: Scott L.

description:
Friendly staff, great coffee, sample chocolates, and cute atmosphere. 
We got the 3 most popular drinks: truffogato, soco-latte (mocha), and caramel latte. We substituted milk with almond milk for 50 cents. 
Truffogato was too strong and caramel latte was a bit too sweet for me, but my friends liked them. Soco-latte was made to perfection though. It had a great balance of sweet and bitter taste of chocolate mixed with nutty taste of almond milk. 
They only have one tiny table and bar seats so might be a good idea to get your coffee to go!
author: Chloe C.

description: I love this place! Super friendly staff and great coffee and chocolate selections. It's my go-to for a good latte. Also, there's always something new to sample :)
author: Sonny V.

description: Tried a cup of hot chocolate here recently and while it was pretty good it wasn't knock your socks off good. It was $5 for a large . The service is really good here and they also sells Truffles , Coffee and other chocolate items as the name of the venue suggests.
author: Rod M.

description: Visiting SF for a few days and this was probably the best coffee that I had. The Mocha w/ Almond milk was excellent!
author: Brad D.

description:
This place is so charming!! And alpaca! Alpaca everywhere! It's Socola's mascot and you can see them incorporated in their chocolates. It's a quiet and cozy chocolate AND COFFEE shop! It's a nice contract since it's super loud and busy where they're located.

Their chocolates are the main star. They have so many unique flavors! this makes their shop stand out above the rest of the chocolate competitors. A few of my favorites - the matcha and jasmine. If you're feeling bold and adventurous, try the sriracha and durian. 

Only con. Remember how I told you they're located near a busy street? Well, parking is a bitch to find. When I was visiting this place, there were some road constructions, which made U turns (or any turns) impossible! Hopefully, the parking fairy will be on your side when you visit this place.
author: Leena N.

description:
Such friendly staff! Such good beverages!

Came here on a weekday to get a AM coffee fix. Decided to treat myself to something indulgent and try the soco-latte, which is basically a mocha + chocolate marshmallow. The shop is cute, relatively small so its definitely a to-go place. No line when I arrived and the cashier was kind.

Waiting for my drink, I noticed they had free samples of some of their chocolate out! Omg, so good. The thought crossed my mind that even if the drink was bad, that I would still come back for the chocolate.

Luckily though, that scenario didn't come to pass, because my drink was delicious as well! The yummy chocolate flavor permeated the beverage, and even with a drink lid on, I still indulged in the marshmallow melting in my cup.

I definitely couldn't order this every day, but you can bet next time I want to treat myself in downtown SF, Socola will be on the top of my visit list.
author: Angela C.

description:
The moment I stepped inside, I was in alpaca heaven. Who doesn't love an alpaca theme? A monster, that's who. 

I haven't tried the coffee here, but the chocolates are tasty and adorable. They aren't overly sweet and are melt in your mouth goodness. My favorite was the earl grey. You can really taste the tea flavor.
author: Lucinda H.

description:
Absolutely amazing chocolate!

Wonderful variety of flavors such as sriracha, guava, and jasmine.

Extremely friendly service.

I very highly recommend!!!

Will definitely be back for more and to try the coffee drinks and pastries which look so good. :)
author: Joshua M.

description:
This place is one of my favorite cafe settings in San Francisco. I used to come here 2-3 times a week when I worked nearby because I needed to please my sweet tooth. There may not be WiFi but it's just a nice place to relax and enjoy a creamy soco-latte, a mix of latte and hot chocolate. The soco-latte also comes with a large marshmallow on top and it's just the perfect drink when you're looking for some comfort. 

I've bought their bite-size chocolates on various occasions, whether it was bringing a treat to my co-workers or a friend. The chocolates come in cute packaging that makes it a nice gift. 

The staff are also really friendly! It's always nice to go there and have a nice chat with them.
author: Jason F.

description: Maybe I'm just a contrite New Yorker-er but I quite frankly think EVERYTHING in San Francisco is overpriced.  Pricing aside, this place is pretty awesome.  It is a great coffee spot, the service is great, but owing to the over-pricey nature of it all, I don't know that I can give it 5 stars.  It is a SOLID place to get a gift for someone, the chocolates are unique and yummy, and the coffee is more than solid.
author: Aruna A.

description:
Socola Chocolatier is a small but really cute chocolate and coffee shop. It smells so delightful as soon as you walk in. The individual chocolates are displayed in a glass window and the large menu is above the register; makes it really easy to order. 

I just love their San Francisco Collection, which is a 12-piece box. Pictured on the chocolates are the Golden Gate Bridge, the Painted Ladies, Alcatraz, and SF's iconic cable car. So adorable! The flavors of the chocolates are hazelnut, champagne, dark chocolate, and fernet. The hazelnut was my favorite. It had a crispy interior, which was a textural contrast to the creamy chocolate. 

As far as the coffee goes, the truffogato is adorably tiny but packs a big punch! It's strong espresso with a chocolate marshmallow. The soco-latte (mocha) is more my speed. And the chocolate marshmallow was delicious!
author: Rose A.

description:
This place is definitely one of the more unique places I've gone to in SF. Being a place that specializes in hot chocolate, I was looking forward to getting myself a cup! The venue is very tiny with a couple small tables, a couch area, and a little bar stool area. Unfortunately, I don't think there was wifi here so no work could've been done if I needed Internet. The staff here is very friendly and will bring your drinks to your table if you order for here.

I got the chocolate marshmallow that comes with the hot chocolate and it really added a nice touch. There is also beautiful hot chocolate art on the drink. The hot chocolate is very rich but not overly sweet but the marshmallow was definitely too sweet for me to finish. Overall, I really recommend getting some hot chocolate from here at least once!
author: Catherine S.

description: I stopped by to get a quick chocolate fix. Unfortunately I was too close to closing time and most things had run out, coffee machine stopped but I was able to buy a few chocolates for the road. I picked just 4 and I really enjoyed the flavors. However I thought it was incredibly overpriced. For the price, I much prefer La Maison du Chocolat...
author: Thomas L.

description: This was one of the cutest cafes ever, with their alpaca themed restaurant cold brew was really good, workers were very nice, and the chocolate was delicious. It was pretty decently pricey $11 for 4 chocolates and I think around $5 for the coffee, but most definitely worth it
author: Kara P.

description: I love stopping by in the morning to get a simple pastry and a small cup of coffee. And when I say simple, I mean only in comparison to the rest of their amazing selection. But for me, I am a baked good person so I am thankful they keep them in stock and they are so delicious. Also thankful that they have a tasty pot of coffee ready to go. Nice people, great service.
author: Marcus E.

description:
Llama llama, yes says mama to all the chocolate. With a theme like llamas and chocolate, Socola wins over the heart of someone who appreciates quirk and quality. Upon entering this little chocolate shop located in SoMa, you forget the hustle and bustle of the construction and traffic outside and become a big kid in a sophistciated candy store. Employees are busy crafting hand made chocolates and your senses get to enjoy the aroma of coffee and chocolate -- two of the best things on earth, next to air. 

We ordered the Soco-latte and a Caramel latte, both made to perfection and complete with latte art. Our lattes were smooth and smoky with just a touch of sweet from both the caramel and the chocolate. The Soco-latte comes with a homemade choco marshmallow that blends nicely into the latte. What a wonderful pick me up to end the week.

Service was quick and friendly, which is a definite plus in my book. Would be back in a heart beat. Thanks for making my morning, Socola.
author: Amy L.

description:
Amazing truffles, friendly staff, and a nice place to sit down and cool off on a hot day (or warm up with a nice coffee, depending on the fickle SF weather these days). I loved the "Squirrel and a nut" chocolate they have and the truffles were delicious. My favorite was probably  The Hot Lava which is described as: succulent raspberry pate de fruit with champagne ganache. I also enjoyed the Duchess of Earl, Stout Beer, and Give it to me Guava. At $11 a pop for a box of four, they are certainly not cheap, but they are delicious and quite beautiful.

Bonus points for having a flying alpaca logo, because why not.
author: Nikki M.

description: Chocolates were excellent. Truffogato was good. Would get mocha next time. Service was great
author: Rev G.

description: As soon as I saw it was alpaca themed I knew I was going to love it. There were cute little stuffed animals and paintings of alpacas scattered throughout. If alpacas aren't your thing, it's still an awesome coffee shop. I got the soco-latte and it was deliciously rich. The truffle-gato (truffle + affogato) sounded amazing too. Next time. I didn't get any of their chocolates or pastries but they looked divine. I saw a lot of people come in for chocolates while I was there. Did I mention it was Valentine's Day and they were all guys? Anyways. Only bummer is the space is small so it's more of a grab and go rather than sit down and sip coffee for a few hours type place.
author: Sara T.

description:
It was sprinkling outside a little and I'm just visiting The SoMa region of SF for a little while, so I ended up wandering in here so I could stop and wait for the Ferry Building Marketplace to open up. It's a small, trendy looking place with clean interior. I'm loving the alpaca logo (sho cyootie-patootie)! 

I got a small soco-latte. It's beautiful, with a chocolate covered marshmallow garnishing the top. Creamiest. Dreamiest. Ever. 

I always love a good, well-foamed latte, and this was so smooth! I scooped up a bit of the foam with a spoon and was in heaven. Not too sweet, but warming and rich in flavor.

They had some chocolate samples out and I tried the Marsala Chai and one with Raspberry Champagne. I don't think I really noticed the flavor of the Chai, but the smoothness was definitely outstanding. The raspberry was flavored really well and actually made me start considering a small box despite their super high prices. My wallet is crying a little, but I'm still trying to decide as I type this in the cafe!!! Yelp DOES have a 10% off deal for first-time check-ins.....and they have some pretty interesting flavors out like cognac and hot lava and sriracha.....so....... Brb going to buy chocolate now.
author: Diane J.

description:
Went in on a Friday evening, had a range of truffles to choose from. Delightful visuals, and amazing taste. My family loved it. 
Looking forward to the SF collection, was told that I could get them around holiday time.
author: Jaishree V.

description:
I love having one of the best chocolate shops in the city so close to my TV! I only wish they delivered and were open 24/7.

Get a hot chocolate. They've got one of the best in the city. 

My gf would want me to note the Soco-latte . The thing is damn good. Imagine a great moca turned up to eleven. 

To top all of that these are some of the most friendly people in San Francisco. These are the kind of neighbors I love.
author: Justin S.

description: Can you tell we enjoyed it lol! We ordered a caramel iced coffee and banana nut bread ! And it was very good!
author: Jasmin P.

description: This place has great coffee and nice chocolate, hence their latte and mocha are fantastic!
author: Shin H.

description: Amazing service and chocolates. Gifted several boxed chocolates to professional references and everyone love them and their complex depth of flavors. Truly love following them on Insta and have since found a new appreciation for llamas.
author: M M.

description: Try it!! Don't mind their prices, it's worth it. Rich rich rich in flavor!! The service great!! The barista assisted me with my complicated order, something a lot of people won't do.
author: Camerina D.

description: Wow, I'm quite impressed! Right when you walk in you can smell the chocolatey goodness! I went in looking to try the hot chocolate per the many reviews saying it's awesome, but I opted for the caffeine kick and got the soco-latte. WITH MARSHMALLOW! Holy crap, this thing was tasty! You get a good amount of mocha-ness, but can definitely taste the coffee. The soft, pillowy chocolate marshmallow was great. Not too sweet and gave it just a bit more fluffy texture. So smooth! I'm going to have to come back to try some of their other drinks. And probably some of their truffles!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Loved the soco latte with marshmallow here.. 
One of the best coffee places I have been to. Absolutely look forward to trying it more often.

The coffee here is delicious. They do have a lot of other chocolate options as well.
author: Kamiya M.

description:
Some say the way to a girl's heart is chocolate. Not me. I don't care for chocolate unless I'm PMSing which Mr. NSS may argue that's an e-v-e-r-y-d-a-y occurrence. 

Have fun with PALMela and that bottle of Lubriderm, buddy!

Ok. So admittedly, I may be a crazy banshee during those "trying" days but he knows the way to my heart (and how to shut me up): DURIAN, the king of fruits. 

Yes, that deliciously vile smell of stank feet putrefying in a mixture of cow dung, rotten eggs, and rancid fish with a sprinkling of gasoline that even Andrew Zimmern (Bizarre Foods) refuses to eat makes me giggle with excitement. If you can ignore the smell, you will be rewarded with an incredibly velvety smooth, sweet custard-like fruit with hints of vanilla, nuts, and a touch of garlic. 

I heard that Socola had a durian truffle flavor but was only available seasonally. Well, after a year of trying (they sell out quickly), I gave up. However, last week, I get an email from Wendy, the owner and she tells me they have the durian truffles in stock! YEEEE! She was kind enough to put a dozen aside for me and I told her I would be there during the weekend to pick it up.

The next day, Mr. NSS met me at my office after work and hands me a teal gift bag. I peak inside and they're durian truffles from Socola: http://bit.ly/1yVJGzt! Apparently, he got on the waitlist too. Good boy!

Now, I've tried many durian products and the durian smell is often subtle meaning there's very little of the real thing used. Not this time...

Me *slowly devours a durian truffle* 
"Omg, these are so good, are you sure you don't want some?" 
*purposely breathes on him*

Mr. NSS *moves away from me* 
"Good gawd, THAT smell--haven't you tortured me enough?" 
*tosses a vibrator from across the room and leaves*

Socola durian truffles: deliciously stinky sweet P-E-R-F-E-C-T-I-O-N.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Good hot chocolate. Is if you swing by this area it's worth a stop I wouldn't make a special trip for it though.
author: James R.

description:
Whimsical and novel flavor choices in their truffles 
Atmosphere is bright and clean with a polished elegance 
Chocolate was smooth and rich with just a hint of bitterness
Some of the flavors were unnoticeable and others more forthcoming (samples are your friend) 
Packaging is reminiscent of something you get from Tiffany's 

Overall Thoughts

If you are in need of a chocolate fix you can't go wrong with Socola
author: Eddie W.

description: I love a well-made latte and this is a great spot to get one.  I walked by many times on my way to work and one day finally stopped in and I was pleasantly surprised.  They often have candy samples out and they are an added bonus.  They make very beautiful candy, so it is a great place to stop by and grab something for a gift, a sample and delicious coffee.
author: Ellen M.

description: Highly recommend soco-latte with their house-made marshmellow! It's possibly the richest and mkst creamy lattes I've ever had. Yummm
author: Kristi K.

description: I love the salty chewy caramel truffles and the truffle-agato coffee drink. The truffla-agato has now beat Mazzarine for my favorite coffee in SF!
author: Aakash P.

description: I cannot say enough good things about this place.  The chocolate is so delicious.  They make really interesting treats you can mix and match.  During my pregnancy my husband would buy me a little box of chocolates of different flavors to have after every doctors appointment.  He got me my favorite, their potato chip/pretzel milk chocolate bar to give to me after the birth!  I got to go for the first time with our new baby and they were all so excited to meet her they gifted me a box of chocolates (with passion fruit, also a favorite)!  So thoughtful and delicious.  I got a caffeine free almond milk latte and it was the best I've had!  They serve Four Barrel coffee.  I normally get my coffee at The Mill so my bar is high, but the barista at Socola is top notch!  I really like that you can watch them make the chocolates in shop!  The little toy llamas are cute :)
author: Liz M.

description:
Ordered just the soco-latte (mocha) with the marsh mellow on top! The marshmallow was coated in a fine chocolate powder which was awesome! The latte itself wasn't strong.


The store was neat and clean. I went just before lunch on a weekday so it wasn't too busy, although the Staff seemed like they could use a little coffee themselves.

Didn't try the chocolates but the soco-latte was good!
author: Shomik C.

description: My husband and I attended the chocolate-making class at Socola. It was an amazing experience. The owner ( Wendy) made it a lot of fun. It was a very informative and engaging class. We got to test our chocolate-making skills and try some delicious creations. I highly recommend it for individuals or couples who are curious about the art of chocolate-making.
author: j v.

description:
With the help of a successful Kickstarter campaign, a pair of enterprising Vietnamese-American sisters opened a boutique chocolate shop that feels like a box of chocolates, Forrest Gump-approved. It's a cute spot on a rather remote block of Folsom with very little pedestrian traffic. That's a bit of a shame since the chocolates are good even if they are somewhat premium-priced. Part of the challenge is that the chocolates, as tasty as some of them are, lack distinction, something unique that would make them memorable. As the trio of strippers sang to Louise in "Gypsy", you gottta have a gimmick if you wanna get applause.

The sisters proclaim they make "artisanal confections with modern flavors and a fantastic taste of fun".OK but was I having fun? When do we get to the fun part? I came here with Jamie W. and noticed they're trying to be more than just a chocolate shop. They also serve espressos and pastries in an attempt to expand their budding market. We sat a spell at an open table mightily sharing a small selection of their chocolates - Passion Fruit Vanilla Bean, Burnt Baby Burnt (Burnt Caramel) with Sea Salt, Vietnamese Espresso and Bacon (photo: http://bit.ly/1rLzLcH).

The price was high at $9.95 for a quartet, but that makes it comparable to what you would pay at Recchiuti Chocolates in the Ferry Building. Keep in mind I'm the type that gets excited at the prospect of a free chocolate square at Ghirardelli's. Socola's were tasty confections for sure, but I still think the quality at Recchiuti is better, richer, more velvety. More practice perhaps. To top it all off, I even had a $4.50 cup of the Truffogato, a Four Barrel espresso topped off with a chocolate truffle (photo: http://bit.ly/1pVyqk6). I was hoping for a little more kick to go with the sweet, but it never quite happened as I sipped it.

CHOCOLATES - 3 stars...good but not distinctive enough to be memorable, perhaps I should have tried a durian one
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...like a box of chocolates
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...quiet tentativeness
TOTAL - 3 stars..."Get yourself a gimmick and you, too, can be a star!"
author: Ed U.

description:
Every time I have walked into this shop I have been greeted with a hearty hello and a warm smile. The care and respect they give to anyone walking into the shop has translated into the drinks, you can really taste the love . 

So far my choice of drink has been the soco latte, if you are a fan of something sweeter and chocolatey then I definitely recommend it.
author: Adrian L.

description: Really good chocolates here, on par with the best I've had. They're small but packed with flavor, and their flavors range from pretty traditional to a bit off the wall, e.g. from a raspberry based flavor, to durian.
author: Bruce C.

description: Socolate (mocha) here is perfect for me! It's not too sweet and has rich chocolate taste!
author: Katie T.

description: Oh I wish my metabolism would allow me to stop here more often! It's on my way to work, and much more pleasant than Philz, with personalized, attentive service that doesn't make you feel uncool or inferior. They always have free samples, and all of their chocolate is so exquisite and seductive -- I can't ever leave without getting a square or two. They also cure headaches! Okay, I dunno how much truth there is to that, but I DID come in with a raging migraine that no medication had yet cured, and I got a mocha and some chocolate, and my headache vanished. Really, a lovely experience all around, headache or otherwise.
author: Liz A.

description:
What do you do when you see your ex from 20 years ago, the one you thought you'd move to New York for, the one who told you after you'd left him that he "regretted for not putting a ring on your finger"? You go to Kee's on West 39th and buy something decadent. Because what better way to say to a man "you screwed up and I know that you know you've screwed up" than handing him a box of chocolate?

When I first walked into Socola, I told the owner this place reminded me of Kee's in Midtown. She knew what I was talking about. Nice. Very few people get my constant obnoxious New York references here in San Francisco.

On my first expedition to Socola, I got durian chocolate truffles and took a photo and send it to B. I take durian very seriously. And I enjoy mocking B with it with every photo I take from every part of southeast Asia, for years now.  B hates such things and he says "yuck" back to the truffle photo and I laugh with delight. 

Sriracha is another good one because it packs heat. Lychee, Ginger, Guava, Beer, Cognac, and PBJ. Get a box of twelve and you get a 10% off from Yelp Check in.

Today I asked the owner if she had durian. She was out she said. But after packing up 12 in a box, she handed me a durian chocolate truffle as a free bonus because they didn't have it that day for sale. I had a work related pounding headache in the afternoon, and I inhaled my treat and in five minutes I was as good as new.

Socola is a small but delightful boutique chocolate cafe. It has a very inviting and clean vibe. Sort of reminds me of Fahrenheit Coffee in Toronto, a good side note: pastries are also delightful - Guava croissant feels very Miami. 

I now buy from Socola and not Kee's. As it turns out, chocolate is better here, just like men!
author: Victoria E.

description:
OMG... this place is too cute!!! 

Just came back from a quick morning coffee run with the coworker and at this moment... so glad that they moved around the corner from our building! 

Ambiance: modern decor... spacious... airy... 

Staff: friendly (might have been a little too wired from all the chocolate and the awesome coffee) but definitely excited and friendly! 

First sip of my soco-latte (I think that's the name...) "wow!" was my first word! Talk about chocolate goodness and it was made just right (temperature wise...)

They sell chocolates (truffles) and pastries... which we didn't get since we were tight on time... but will definitely check them out for any last minute gifts needed ... and oh hey... VDAY is this Friday... well worth checking out lovebirds!

Definitely will be my go-to coffee spot!!!
author: Cath M.

description:
I took the truffle making class at Socola with chocolatier/owner Wendy tonight.   Not only did I learn a lot, the class was a blast!  Plus, I came home with a very pretty box of a dozen of their gorgeous signature truffles that we made (very hands on) in class.

Wendy is extremely knowledgeable, and super fun. She was great at pulling the group together, and the class was a great value. The wine pairings were perfect too. I will certainly be using my new chocolate making chops to make truffles at home soon!!
author: Julie N.

description:
Try their caramel latte with almond milk. I literally get it almost everyday, it's my favorite thing on earth. They also have a pastry happy hour, $2 off everything in their pastry case! I especially like their guava croissant. There's a few little couches inside to enjoy your coffee and chocolates, but this isn't a *do work and get high on caffeine* type of cafe, and I think that adds to its charm :) 

Go to Socola, get your caramel latte, buy a box of chocolates for someone you fancy, become a better person.

And don't forget to stamp your loyalty card.
author: Laura M.

description: Very cozy chocolate place. Seems it out place for the location. Chocolates are delicious, but the chocolate drinks were a bit ordinary.
author: Dan K.

description: Super cute little coffee and chocolate shop in SoMa. Get the soco-latte (their version of a mocha) and definitely add the homemade chocolate marshmallow to it! I also had the guava croissant and it was amazing. Unfortunately I didn't try any of the chocolates, but they all looked beautiful and had a nice assortment of very interesting flavors! I will definitely be back to pick some up in the future. The shop itself is very bright and cheery and everyone working was super friendly and nice!
author: Leith S.

description:
Best chocolate truffles ever!!!! I love all the flavors. Favorites flavors
Passion fruit
PB&J 
Johnnie Walker Blue (pretty sure that one is seasonal) 
Vietnamese Coffee 
Guava 

The coffee is delicious. You can't go wrong with truffles and marshmallows in your coffee. 
The service is amazing! 
It's an awesome open space. Great for a break or coffee anytime of the day.
author: Jyoti A.

description: This place is beautiful and so are there products but the prices are way too expensive. It should not cost $15 for an Espresso - To Go, "Happy Hour" pastry (especially when the mini one costs the same as the regular size.. and 2 mini Chocolate Bunnies.. The service was great but I will not be back to visit.
author: Annie K.

description: I'm not a good friends of chocolate, but this place make you want more. Their Hazelnut chocolate smooth and crispy. Highly recommended these places.
author: Chrissy C.

description: Amazing mocha's! They have a great gourmet chocolate selection. Each has a very different flavor and taste. We generally get an assortment. Also, try them out for holiday gifting! They do a nice assorted gift box.
author: Anisha Y.

description:
12.22.14 etc.

Cute chocolate and coffee shop in the SOMA hood. Inventive truffle flavors. I'm into the green tea matcha. $2.50 a piece!

Quiet place for a cup of coffee as well. The socolatte comes with a piece of marshmallow!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/socola-chocolatier-san-francisco-4?select=Wt7Se9Gmj0Z8UmJDQIdVog#Wt7Se9Gmj0Z8UmJDQIdVog
author: Jenny L.

description:
Just go here.  Blows away most other chocolate truffles I've had.  Perfectly delicate flavors and sweetness.  I had the vegan truffle, espresso truffle, and caramel truffle - all three were 10/10.  Not to mention they serve four barrel coffee, and the staff is super-nice.  

Excited to go back...
author: Jeff R.

description:
I'm a fan because this is more than just a chocolate shop. I'm in love with their guava croissant. Whether I'm near or far, there are moments that I crave their guava croissant.

The shop has enough seating for a sit down, so it's convenient enough for me to grab n' go, or sit down and join the pastry with nice cup of coffee in this cute blue interior shop.

I've also order from their lunch menu of refreshing beautiful salads and carefully crafted sandwiches. The owner or lead was also very nice over email communications when I placed a large catering/lunch order for my work meeting.

I can't comment on the chocolate as I have been spoiled by Christopher Elbow chocolates, but this shop is more than just a chocolatier to me. It is my lquiet/quaint lunch spot as well.
author: Yum Y U M.

description: Good coffee, open later than most coffee options in SOMA. It's really close to my office which is another plus. The guy who is always working in the late afternoon is really nice and helpful. Tried the chocolate and it was okay, nothing to write home about. It's cool they make it all in house.
author: Jonah K.

description:
This little chocolate shop is right next to my trainer in SOMA, so I stopped in today while waiting for him to show.  Excellent hot chocolate, and a large variety of truffles (with samples on the bar).  They also have some baked goods, and prepackaged chocolate bars.

Will definitely drop by often.
author: Joey Y.

description: Using Uber delivery did not make sense so Andrew took it upon itself to deliver the chocolates to my client during his break. Chocolates were delivered within the hour. Great service from this local chocolate store.
author: Emmanuel P.

description:
I came across this place when I was tired to death. This cute little shop with turquoise color made me relax with their great treats!

They serve Four Barrel Coffee, one of the best roaster known for third wave coffee. I'm a big fun of coffee so that I expected much. When they serve the cup, that exactly meet my expectation!

Every treats look so good, but I picked chocolate macaron. Actually nice. Outsides are  crunchy and cream inside was rich.

Two owners were friendly and smiling, the shop is small but cozy. 
Nice chocolatier, I do like this place!
author: Rika N.

description:
A pretty cool looking small business in my new work neighborhood.  When I was walking by, I noticed that they had the cafe equipment as well as chocolates displayed in their front display case.  Coincidentally,  I had to get a housewarming gift for my friend the following day so why not support small business right?

I got a package of 12 chocolates for $25.  I didn't taste the chocolates themselves as it was a gift but I did see them being eaten and the box was half gone before I left their home.

Even when I came here after 5pm on a Friday, Wendy and her staff were welcoming and friendly.  Who knows how long they work during their normal workday so I must give them props for putting in the time to make their business grow and succeed!

I'm hoping and looking forward to try their pastries and Four Barrel coffee on my way to work one of these cold mornings!
author: Ben H L.

description:
I've heard of Socola way before they had this storefront when they were at the Vintner's Market at Fort Mason a few years back, and fell in love with their unique flavors, such as the sriracha flying rooster truffle & burnt caramel.

So I was happy to hear that they were opening a location so close to me...these chocolates are mainly on the pricier end, but definitely worth it when you want to splurge on some amazing chocolate. 

I mainly frequent this place though since they Four Barrel coffee. I've only ever had their lattes and their  "soco-latte, (mocha)", which had an option of having a chocolate marshmallow added. I loved that their soco-latte wasn't too sweet. So delicious, will be back.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Super friendly guy behind the till, delicious and beautiful chocolates on display, the serving of Four Barrel coffee, and the fact that they're open on the weekend is a win-win situation for this South Beach girl. Having only been in once, the coffee was delicious and their breakfast pastries looked amazing.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Lisa I.

description:
The new Socola chocolate shop is a gorgeous little oasis of calm on Folsom Street. It's a beautiful place, and you can see it's run by people with a passion for excellent chocolate, coffee, and customer service. I had a Four Barrel espresso poured over a dark chocolate truffle, which was delicious. Also tried a super bacon and onion croissant made by local baker Patisserie Phillipe, and a couple types of their house-made chocolates. Nice sitting areas, great service, quiet background music. 

I'd definitely come here again to meet up with friends or to bring visitors. Who am I kidding, i'd come back just to treat myself to a coffee and some of their addictive salty caramel chocolates! They have plenty of boxes of house-made chocolates on hand for Valentine's Day too, so you can take care of business while you treat yourself.
author: C J.

description:
A hidden gem off the tourist and business areas of SOMA. The attention to details by the barista when preparing a macchiato is great and this is probably the best macchiato I've had outside of Vivace in Seattle.
I did not come here for the chocolate but ended up buying a couple of them as a gift for a friend and she absolutely loved them. Might have to come back for some for myself next time I'm in SF. :)
author: Roberth K.

description:
Cute chocolate shop with owner/chef who cares deeply about the product. The cognac chocolate is excellent - would highly recommend.

the pain au chocolat is way too big! I had it for lunch, which is probably OK. but I can't imagine having it for breakfast or as a snack...
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Super friendly service.
Great pastries - both their almond croissant and this other almond thing that comes in a square are great. 
Really good cold brew!
Open on Saturdays.
author: Amy O.

description: Socola made monogrammed truffles as favors for our wedding, and they were so delicious and beautiful! Wendy was such a pleasure to work with from the very beginning, helping me with every detail. I would recommend Socola to anyone looking for some special treats for any occasion, and I'm looking forward to stopping by their shop! Thank you so much Wendy and the Socola team!!
author: Nahal A.

description: Pretty good chocolates. Hubby loved the cognac truffle that he got. I don't care for the taste of anything alcohol infused, so I didn't try it. I got something too, I think something with caramel. Sadly, whatever it was that I got didn't make much of an impression on me because I can't even remember it a few weeks later. The only thing we can remember is the cognac truffle. I'd go again and try other things.
author: Goldi J.

description: Loved the place!! The service and the Moka coffee was amazing! I will definitely go back!
author: Denisse F.

description: Wendy and her team created beautiful chocolates featuring the Pramata logo for our holiday gifts to customers and staff.  Thank you so much for all of your hard work!
author: Sarah C.

description:
Love this addition to the neighborhood! 

We stopped in for coffee and sampled some amazing chocolates! They had a small assortment of baked goods hopefully they will expand their offerings.
author: Mimi T.

description:
So happy Wendy and her staff found a new home!  Needed to make sure I did my due diligence and update my previous review (below) since the world is a happier place when delicious chocolates are part of our daily diet!  I can't wait to eat my way through the entire menu - you can't go wrong with whatever you try.


PREVIOUS REVIEW:

Can truffles be sexy??  How about mouthwatering and delectably delicious?  Being a huge chocolate fan - I am very picky when it comes to my chocolate.  There's only so much chocolate a girl can consume before it hits the waistline...(Note to self - try not to overindulge)...

Anyways,  I'm surprised I've never yelp about the Lieu sisters!  Wendy and Susan are geniuses!  Wendy, the chocolatier herself, and Susan - the savvy business entrepreneur has come up with some amazing concoctions! Ingredients I just couldn't see tasting all that great together  became instant favorites!  Vietnamese coffee, bacon, guiness...who knew they'd be so delicious with chocolate!  Each truffle packs amazing flavors that isn't overpowered by the chocolate - it's like the perfect tango!

I've been devouring their chocolates for years.  Not only do they get more sophisticated as time passes, but more creative and if possible - more enticing. I realize now that I am very deserving of the finer things in life - truffles included!  

They take orders year round and if lucky, you may be able to find them in a few select stores.  Currently, I know for a fact their truffles are showcased at Bi-rite Market...def check it out - esp if you're waiting in line at Bi-Rite Creamery...mmmmm..craving a balsamic strawberry now!

Ooh FYI:   
Sôcôla - best chocolate of the east bay 2009 - diablomag.com/Diablo-Mag...
author: Julie H.

description: I really liked this place. They are so polite and respectful. I loved the socolatte  you should definitely try it.
author: Sara K.

description:
I found this place because of Cherylynn's review. I saw durian truffle and I knew I had to get them for my sister. She LOVES durian. I am not a fan at all. I heard they only make it once in awhile and I emailed Socola to let me know when they do have the durian to please let me know. The owner, Wendy (super friendly) emailed me back in 5 minutes saying she had one box left and will save it for me. I told her I want it shipped and she replied back quickly with a link to purchase. Shipping is $5. She said it might take a few days to arrive. It arrived the next day and she put a little ice pack with it also. 

The service was wonderful. Wendy answers your emails so quickly and is very helpful and friendly. The truffles can last in the fridge up to 3 weeks. A little pricey, but they are one of a kind. 

I surprised my sister with it and she said it was very good. She doesn't even like sweets, but she loved it. She said she it had a lot of durian flavor in it, so 5 stars all the way!
author: Karen H.

description: Always makes me smile to come in here. Staff are friendly and welcoming, chocolate is SOOO good, and I personally think the best americano I've had to date. Seating is limited!
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Tiny little store, thier dark chocolate is high quality and has a great melting factor. I came to try the durian truffles and they did not disappoint!  

They run out quickly so I called 2 days ago to reserve a 1/2 dozen for myself. It's a dark chocolate coating with a fresh durian/white chocolate filling. Super creamy, delicious with a great mouth feel. I don't understand how people say it smells disgusting because it sure smells and tastes like heaven to me lol. To each thier own I guess. I will definitely be stopping by again when I have a chocolate craving. They are a bit pricier but with such quality ingredients and exotic flavors I don't mind.
author: K N.

description: I was gifted a 12 piece box of Socola Chocolate artisan truffles as a christmas present. I had never tried their chocolates and was beyond impressed by the taste, quality, presentation, and deliciousness of each bite.  In true San Francisco fashion, Sôcôla truffles are made with local ingredients, including Straus Creamery butter and cream. Each unique truffle is so full of flavor, your palate sings and your soul feels happy. One piece is so rich it satisfies any chocolate craving. My favorites so far are the  "burnt baby burnt" sea salt truffle and the matcha green tea. The 12 piece gift box made for such a delightful present that I'll have to stop by their store front to give those I love a taste of their fine chocolate. After all, good chocolate is meant to be shared... I can't wait to indulge in more of their handmade, artisanal treats and gift others a chance to enjoy them with me.
author: Caroline J.

description:
Very good coffee, made super fast. The shop is incredibly charming, and the chocolate is delightful. My only feedback would be that the staff could be a little more friendly - I'd like to chat more with them but they're a bit quiet. 

But seriously - really great coffee. And I'm from Melbourne.
author: Dani W.

description:
I stopped by to get a drip coffee and a box of four truffles. The guy at the counter showed me his two favorites (peanut butter jelly and bourbon) and I agree with him - they were outstanding. However, the other two I got (vietnamese coffee and something else - maybe caramel) were unmemorable. I'll be back to try more (their truffles and packaging are adorable) - and am planning on including another peanut butter jelly truffle in the next box for sure.

Drip coffee wasn't great. Tasted chalky and too acidic for me. Should have opted for the socolatte :P.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Love Love Love! Wendy and team created beautiful branded chocolates for my company offsite. The employees loved them! They were delicious as well as gorgeous! I would highly recommend Socola for any of your swag needs. They were responsive, detail oriented and very easy to work with. Thanks Wendy!
author: Maya B.

description: Socola has a nice offering of chocolates, but the staff can be moody, which is unfortunate.  A nice alternative for a coffee fix over Starbucks a block away.
author: Rafael R.

description:
Guava croissant= heaven! 

Peppermint lavender tea was good but be careful because it comes in an open tea bag and the tea leaves can easily fall into your tea
author: Melissa A.

description: This review is just for the mocha that I had there, which is almost certainly the best mocha I've ever had. It's late in the afternoon, so I just did a shot of caf, / shot of decaf, but this thing is so delicious, the froth on it is perfect, all the ingredients are perfectly blended, it is not too sweet... the quality of the chocolate is divine (this place makes chocolates so this must be the same chocolate, and it is very high quality, to my tastebuds anyway). And the thing that puts it over the top- the single, homemade chocolate marshmallow they topped it with. Yum!
author: Kristen R.

description: Very nice but a little pricey.  Our favorites were the Stout beer, expresso, and burnt caramel.
author: Bob F.

description: Popped in on Saturday for some chocolatey delights.  I really like them because not only do they taste good, but they're super cute as well.  They look like little bugs!  Cute!
author: Shaun W.

description:
Just hosted a truffle making party this weekend as part of a school fundraiser. We have been fans of Socola for years, but this is the first time we had spent considerable time in the shop. Wendy did a great job of telling about the process of going from chocolate to truffle. Our three "teams" then got to make ganache and dip our own truffles. Yum!

We also did a wine and truffle pairing to end the evening. Again, fun to combine the wine and truffle to discover the "third" flavor. 

And the best part? Taking home lots of our own handmade truffles to enjoy!
author: Vivek M.

description: Saw they had guava croissants here so I popped in to grab one. I found out they don't actually make the croissant but it's delivered by a separate bakery. Honestly was a bit disappointed by the croissant because the bread to jelly ratio was completely off. Way too much pastry for way too little guava jelly. I've sampled 4 different chocolates here and they were all excellent - Carmel, sriracha, vietnamese coffee, and passionfruit. I will come back and buy some chocolates for special occasions!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Super cute alpaca mascot/logo!! I'm selfishly glad people haven't discovered this place because lines for the Starbucks a block away, were out the door. They serve Four Barrel, which they execute flawlessly. 

The Soco-latte (aka mocha) with a chocolate marshmallow is TO DIE FOR. (I'm having one right now and just bumped this review to five stars because zomghellagood. The lattes are also delicious.

The chocolates make for a cute and great gift. I love the Cognac one.. NOM. The macaron was a bit too sweet for my taste. Chocolate samples change up and the owner and the barista are the sweetest. I almost sad that I'm not going to be working nearby.
author: Donna H.

description:
I've always been a fan of Socola Chocolatier. Their chocolates are fun, their packaging is cute, and their flavors are always interesting. Once I heard about their store opening I had to check it out.

The store is located in somewhat of a weird dead zone that has the potential to open up if enough tech companies move in. Right now it feels a little bit awkward. Luckily the store itself is very cute and cozy. Both times I visited someone seemed to be making something chocolate related and I was helped by a friendly staff member.

A box of sweets can range from $10-30 depending on chocolate type. Are these the best sweets in the city? I wouldn't bet on it. Although if you want something different, unique, and well presented I'd be hard pressed to recommend any place else off the top of my head.
_____

Try it, you just might love it. I wonder if they make their own pastries? If so I'll have to get one next time.
author: Michael H.

description:
Solution oriented.

Making a traditional chewy caramel candy unique with a dash of salt.

Solving my request for a three shot Americano with a double shot plus half caffeinated/half decaffeinated second shot. Nonfat milk available.

Offering a bag of just homemade granola featuring oats, pecans, pumpkin seeds and honey even though the menu states you can only get it with yogurt or fruit.

Results were excellent, potent and delicious.

Caffeine ($3) and granola ($4) were more than reasonable. Chocolate square ($2.50) was a bit steep but you can't put a price tag on brilliance.

Not to mention the great staff that offered up so many custom and enjoyable solutions to my breakfast and dessert needs.
author: Jason B.

description: Simply dreamy chocolates that are to die for. oh so good and the flavors are delicious. A bit pricey but worth the extra $$.
author: Steven W.

description:
This place is super cute with turquoise blue cases of chocolates, yummy desserts (try their guava croissant!), and four barrel coffee!

The staff is super friendly (the owners are sisters), and they make their own chocolate! A plus side to this place as well, it's open in Soma on Saturdays! (not many places in the neighborhood, minus Starbucks, open on Saturdays).
author: Christina C.

description:
Wendy's chocolates rock!  They are not only tasty but also beautifully packaged and make wonderful gifts for out of town guests or hostess gifts.  They are very uniquely San Francisco.  I have ordered chocolates from Socola in the past but this was the first time I got to go into their storefront.  I was picking up 15 boxes for client gifts and decded to walk over as it's pretty close to the office.  it is nice spot for a chocolate or coffee break - very nicely decorated and a fun place to hang out.  

She has very unique combinations in her chocolates and the flavors meld together well  - my current favorites are peanut butter and jelly, earl gray, sea salt caramel, and the coffee one. It's too hard to just pick one flavor!
author: Bebe W.

description:
I love stopping by this cute little shop for my morning pastries and coffee.  They serve four barrel coffee there and it has a nice fruity hint to it.  It's $2.50 for a regular cup of coffee.   

I love their guava croissants and the ham & cheese croissants ($3.75-$3.95).  It's buttery and filling.  They can toast the croissant for you, but 10 seconds in the microwave will accomplish similar results if you're in a rush in the mornings.  They can sell out pretty quickly on some days.

I haven't bought any chocolates yet, but they look amazing.  They have lots of unique flavors.  I think it will make a great gift for any chocolate lover.
author: Ring K.

description:
I love everything about this place - the food, the espresso, the flying alpaca, the truffles... Pure magic! At the close of their opening week, I purchased truffle gift boxes for friends. Though the inventory was almost completely sold out, Wendy put together special boxes for me for the flavors I wanted: Sriracha truffles (spicy, a teeny bit salty, incredibly rich and dark, peanut butter and jelly, vanilla bean and passion fruit, jasmine tea, and assorted tea) as well as burnt sea salted caramels. 

Best of all is their truffugato, which is essentially a melted truffle hand whisked in four barrel coffee co. espresso. It was beautiful, so dark, so DECADENT, and so delicious, sometimes I dream of it at night. 

Last but not least, you MUST order the guassant - a lovely croissant with Mexican cotija cheese and guava jam - it was the perfect combo of salty + sweet + flaky buttery deliciousness. Thank you Wendy! I will be back again! Win win win
author: Festher C.

description:
Anyone who loves coffee as much as I do knows there's a lot that goes into a fantastic cup.

Origin, roast/roaster, grind, amount of grounds, water temperature (& pressure), and brew time. (Did I miss anything?)

Here they use Four Barrels coffee, which is widely regarded as a good roaster.  That said, it's not a guarantee that your coffee or espresso will be good.  I've been to at least 2 other places (not to be named) that serve Four Barrels coffee and it comes out mediocre at best.

Socola is not like that. Their barista -- I believe his name is Josh? -- knows what he's doing.  He consistently pulls some of the best espresso shots I've ever had.  He knows what to look for in terms of timing, volume and crema and he knows how to get it with the proper grind and tamp.

I believe they make all of their coffee with a large french press instead of a drip mechanism, so if you like french press coffee, this is your place.  And I can tell they've brewed it at the proper temperature.  No bitterness, deep complex flavor.

Oh yeah and they have delicious chocolates there too, but honestly I'm not there for that.  The coffee is where it's at for sure.  It's a bit on the pricey side, but totally worth it if Josh is there.  I honestly can't comment on their other baristas.

And fwiw, I feel that their service is personal and more than satisfactory. Their seating area is totally sufficient (I've never seen it full).  The decor inside is amazing (check out the ceiling and the wall covering on the east side).

If you're in the area and you like good coffee (and/or chocolate), you definitely need to check this place out.
author: Steve H.

description:
This place is not on one of the main streets but it definitely worths to walk.

Their truffogato is excellent
author: Ozgur D.

description:
I got four pieces of different flavored chocolates here, sriracha, guava, earl grey and jasmine tea. I guess sriracha and guava are their most famous chocolates, and I choose earl grey and jasmine just because I like tea.

Sriracha: Well.... too spicy for me. The flavor is so strong and you can barely ignore it . I would like it more if it is not that spicy.

Guava: Wow this is amazing, after the first bite I realized that there is a guava fruit jelly inside the chocolate, which is so creative and blew me away. 

Earl grey: Don't know if there is any problem with my tongue bud... when I taste it, I can barely taste any earl grey in this chocolate... which really disappointed me..

Jasmine tea: Unlike earl grey, this is just what I want! You can taste the light jasmine inside the chocolate. 

I would definitely come back again for their chocolates. I also think it would be a great idea to have their chocolates as a gift to friends.
author: Jia-Ying X.

description:
I went in here the other day to buy my girlfriend some chocolates for our anniversary and couldn't be happier with our box.  We're both fans of Socola's chocolate truffles and I especially like the lychee ones.  There was a small mishap with our order, but Wendy totally went out of her way to make things right...you can't beat their customer service.  
If you're looking for a small gift for your girl's birthday, anniversary, valentine's day, or whatever, pick up a box of their chocolates.
author: Winst D.

description: For the socolatte (their mocha) with a marshmallow. OMG. If you like mochas and you're in the hood you gotta try it.
author: Martina R.

description:
A coffee place in Rincon Hill open on Saturdays! You have NO IDEA how great this is for those of us who work in the neighborhood! And I'm not sure what I'm more excited about - the Four Barrel coffee (best in SF make no mistake!) or the Peanut Butter and Jelly chocolates. It's like I died and went to flavor heaven! PB&J Cute Chocolate And Coffee Heaven™ 

Everyone working here is so friendly. Susan and Wendy are way too adorable. If people could figure out the door (which is all glass and has a sign that tells you how to open it and people STILL can't handle it) (handle, door, see what I did there?) (seriously, turn the handle and push, that's it) I'm sure they'd be a lot happier.

I love you Socola! Let's be BFF's!
author: Rosa L.

description:
Despite being told by my doctor to avoid both chocolate and caffeine months ago, I continue go to Socola almost daily to have their Socolatte (mocha).  It's that good.

If not for this place, I think I would be ten pounds lighter, but that's really not a complaint. (#firstworldproblems)

Another problem is I can't go to Starbucks or Peet's anymore because they all taste terrible in comparison now.  

Craving one now...
author: Justin O.

description:
Cute little bakery open Monday - Saturday, closed Sunday, in an area that lacks establishments. 

All of the pastries are really good. My favorite is the guava croissant. 

The workers are all very friendly too!
author: CL S.

description: Eating the guava croissant was about as close as I will ever get to having a religious experience.
author: Charlie D.

description: Honestly, the food was okay but could easily be excellent. Their croissants are made well. I got the ham and cheese but it would've been really good if they weren't so stingy. I don't like this place but I really wanted to. I was stoked when I discovered it after moving in nearby. The very awkward environment with its bitchy/catty barista vibe made me sad my $ wasn't spent in a more professional environment.
author: Jackie K.

description: These are the most healthiest chocolates!   Denial is a good thing when it comes to chocolates.  Their chocolates should be prescribed for all ills and maladies, such as boredom, lack of sexual drive, loss of will to live, and feeling loss, period.  Savor one bite of chocolate and you will wake up from reality to bliss.  Ok, just go and try some for yourself.  The place is near the freeway entrance to Oakland bridge, right across from the Mexico consulate.  Good thing it is far from every where else.  My excuse to walk off the chocolates!
author: Helen L.

description: It's rare to find a chocolatier that has great almond milk espresso drinks: heck it's hard to find a regular coffee shop that does so I am addicted to this place. BTW it's an alpaca not a llama. I don't know about their chocolate because it is all ganache based but I drink the coffee and its Four Barrel. All their baristas are great and friendly, all except one! Oh well... Nobody's perfect.
author: Sirama B.

description: Boutique chocolate and coffee shop. Among the best hot chocolates in SF. Seating area is very limited.
author: Andy D.

description:
I gave this place a chance: twice. I came for the chocolate and I think I know a thing or two about chocolate, being originally from very close to the Swiss border. For credibility: I also frequently visit the other Artisan chocolate places in SF and am not afraid to pay $10 for a 80g bar of regular chocolate and $3 for a piece of truffles, however here the chocolate is wanna-be overpriced for what I can taste in it.
I did an assorted dozen, just like last time, foregoing the ubiquitous flavors like fresh mint. The truffles are largely disappointing. The ganache is O.K but not distinct, and doesn't develop much flavor when melting in your mouth. Some of flavors just distract from good chocolate like the Lychee Pate de Fruit. To be honest the only outstanding and differentiated flavor I found in the Dangerous Durian. It doesn't really cater to my taste ( tastes like old potatoes ) but at least it was a different and differentiated flavor.

I think I did my duty trying them twice and will go back to the established other Artisan shops.
author: Stephen S.

description: Amazing almond cappuccino, but the barista/ cashier was extremely unpleasant. No smile, very sterile. She didn't even ask me if I wanted it for here or to go. I complimented her on how amazing she had made my cap and she just looked up, half smiled and said nothing. Good coffee and chocolates nonetheless.
author: Carmen V.

description: Their chocolates are so awesome! I wish they would open on weekends too. Their chocolate rich mocha is also awesome :)
author: Abhinav S.

description: chocolates are ok..I still prefer Rech..at the ferry building more. I spoke to some friends I sent there and they said service was just ok for a place that isn't bustling all day long. I do like the coffee there but I wouldn't go out of my way for it. I wish there was more sitting area.  The kitchen looks way big compared to the customer seating and waiting area.
author: Emm C.

description:
This place is amazing and the staff is really nice and friendly. Things I recommend:

*Ham & cheese croissant - ask to get it warmed up. They're so good you'll want to roll your eyes into the back of your head when you take a bite. I'm not joking
 
* LATTE - I ask for a little caramel in mine and it's amazing. In fact anything with their caramel is a good choice

* Jasmine tea - it's loose leaf and delicious

* Cold brew - tastes a bit like chocolate 

* the chocolate - tons of different flavors to choose from and they're made fresh right behind the counter. There's always samples to try while you're in there as well
author: Nechelle D.

description:
Great staff, open airy location and bright relaxed atmosphere. 

I really enjoy hitting up this joint once or twice a week to grab hot chocolate. If you are in the market for something dark, cocoa inspired and infused with sugar I think Socola is a great place to take a short break. 

The giant windows give you tons of light and really open up the space. They use Four Barrel beans for all of their drinks if you need a bit of coffee in your day. 

Additionally, I would add that their marshmallows are made with chocolate too. I actually kindly ask for two marshmallows in my hot chocolate which they oblige with no problem. 

Very nice atmosphere, very clean and SF Made approved.
author: Kristian H.

description: I'm giving it 4 stars for the chocolate. I took the pb&j, which can be passed. The jelly and peanut butter just don't meld well. This coming from one who still loves the occasional pb&j sandwich (confession). But the Masala Chai, Burnt Baby Burnt, and Vietnamese Coffee chocolates were delicious. Smooth with distinct flavours that combined nicely on the tongue. The coffee, though,... I had an espresso and I hate to say it, but it tasted like the beans had been burnt and the grounds overly compacted. I won't get it again. However, I will be back for more chocolate!
author: Meghan S.

description: I am probably missing out on the best that Socola has to offer because I cannot eat gluten, sugar, or chocolate. I came here for the one legal drug that I do still consume -- coffee! The latte I had was just OK. The location is a bit out of the way for me, and with so many other good coffee places nearby, the coffee was not good enough to convince me to return.
author: Patricia D.

description: I never like chocolate until my wife made me try this one. Wow amaze balls! Their coffee is delicious!! They're four barrel coffee and i would come here every morning before I go to work if I work in downtown. Just a few blocks away from downtown. The owner is soooo nice and very welcoming. She sure does know her stuff. Go there!!
author: Henry K.

description:
I randomly found out about Socola while reading a blog and  visited them. Wow, the chocolate is phenomenal because the little hints of flavors they add to the chocolate is so different than other vendors. 

Yes, there are so many chocolatiers around town but it's overdone and the chocolate shell is either too thick, the caramel's too sticky, etc, flavors were meh.

 I love the Vietnamese coffee one the most from Socola. It is not overpowering at all.  Sriracha one OMG!!! Their flavors are so creative and awesome!!!

The staff here is super friendly and the chocolate is awesome! Coffee is great too ;).   Check them out, you won't be disappointed!
author: Elena R.

description: Great chocolate almonds, and the employee was fun.  Nice packaging.
author: Niniane W.

description:
They make a mean mocha.  (Sorry, Soco-latte!)  Usually I think that chocolate "kills" the flavor of coffee, but they pair a nice robust four barrel coffee with rich but not cloying chocolate ganache, which really marries the coffee and chocolate notes very well.  As the coup de grace, they float a house made rich chocolate marshmallow on top.  The marshmallow adds just a note of sweetness as you sip the latte, and there's usually enough left at the end to serve as the perfect little treat.  

The chocolates that they make are extremely well executed.  These are not rustic hand rolled truffles, but sophisticated well crafted and extremely presentable little gems that your significant other would simply *love* to receive in a little box to celebrate that next special occasion.

They leave some samples on the counter, and I must confess to liberally taking advantage of their generosity, and can tell you that they are very good at pairing chocolate with some unusual flavors, but by far my favorite has been their vietnamese coffee flavor, which was suprisingly not too sweet and really allowed the coffee and chicory flavor to shine.
author: steffan z.

description:
Known for their chocolates, but I like to come here for coffee and pastries. They even heat up the pastries which makes it taste better.

As for the chocolates, get any of the caramel or truffle chocolates. I get them for my wife whenever I walk by. 

Solid four stars!
author: Andrew C.

description: went ehre today and its a very cute store. very clean and a decent amount of seating. i got a cafe au lait and it was delish. they have almond milk and also serve four barrel coffee. The Barisa was a super nice guy too and let us stay a bit over the 3PM closing. I did get a few pieces of chocolate as well. $2.50 each of if you get 4 its $10
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I needed 30 boxes of chocolates and Wendy one of Lieu sisters (co-founder) was helpful and ready to make my custom order. While i waited she offered to try a couple of her extremely indulgent handcrafted truffles. How could i say NO the Hazelnut Praline was heaven sent. I would definitely recommend this place to go have some yummy truffles and sip on a coffee or even a pastry.
author: Max J.

description:
Being in the SoMA area for a week now, I've been :test driving" various independent espresso bars.

I haven't experienced Socola's chocolate, but the coffee and customer experience is uninspired. Coffee is tepid and they seemed to be interested in managing my coffee intake.

When trying to order a triple macchiato, they felt the need to point out that they pull doubles(duh)....and suggested adding a shot of decaf. They worked hard to not deliver what I wanted.

The hunt continues.
author: Mark M.

description: Service was great and their passion fruit vanilla bean truffles are the best! We accidentally went to the previous location by accident, so make sure you go to the new location. I bought a box of 12 for $25 and so far it's lasted me two weeks!
author: Vi P.

description: The burnt caramel chocolate truffle is great. The sriracha one is overdone. In my opinion the heat should be more subtle. The staff is very friendly. I had an Americano and it was okay. Not bitter or anything but a little weak for my taste.
author: Kristen D.

description: My husband brought me home chocolates and caramels from a business trip, and WOW, were they amazing. The caramels with sea salt were honestly some of the best I'm ever had--and I LOVE caramels. The chocolates were silky smooth. The flavors were: passion fruit vanilla bean (yummy and so tart!) French chicory toffee (a Vietnamese coffee taste--bitter but so sweet) PBJ (not my style but my husband loved it) Notorious HOG (OMG this one! So good!) Duchess of Earl (loved it, bergamot is one of my favorite flavors with chocolate) Burnt Baby Burnt (more caramel) and Salty Chewy Caramel. The only thing I didn't like? The sriracha one. I'm fine with spicy chocolate, but it tasted of actual sriracha which, in case you didn't realize it, has a crapton of garlic. I'm not a fan of garlic chocolate. Otherwise, don't miss these delicious chocolates!
author: Jacquelyn P.

description: Although on the pricier side I can appreciate one's craft and passion for something.  At this quaint establishment it's clear that the owners put their blood, sweat,  tears, and joy into each rich and decadent chocolate. The flavor ranges are quite impressive from the likings of sriracha, stout (style of beer), cognac, champagne,  et cetera. A nice place to sit, relax, have a coffee and chocolate with a friend.
author: Nathan M.

description: Not knowing anything about the background of this place, my wife and I stumbled into this cute little chocolate and coffee shop. It's a nice place: clean lines and comfortable seats, plus good coffee and tasty chocolates. Some of the flavors were a little overpowering (the Sriracha had a bit too much garlic flavor for me) but the quality is definitely very good. We came here a few times, and while they had some early service issues, those were ironed out nicely. Heartily recommended.
author: Joel R.

description:
Socola Chocolatier is my new favorite place to get coffee in the city. 

In a place like SF, you'd expect any high-end coffee/pastry/sweets shop to serve quality products that taste as they should. Sadly, not so. 

I've been to waaaaay too many coffee places that fail to brew their expensive beans correctly. I've also purchased way too many sub-par pastries and chocolates and found myself disappointed. 

I went to Socola to get coffee and morning pastries. I picked some up for myself and a friend. The coffee is brewed so well and with such attention to taste that you don't need to add cream or sugar-- the flavor is there. The croissants are literally the best croissants I've ever tasted-- yum! 

I didn't have chocolates that morning, but I've had Socola treats before and they're always original, fresh and just sweet enough to satisfy my most ravenous chocolate craving.
author: J N.

description: Fantastic four barrels coffee and some delicious baked goods. The guava croissant sounds weird but is divine. In the truffles, the raspberry champagne was great, but the sriracha flying rooster was a little too spicy to really go well with the chocolate flavor. Highly recommended!
author: Chetan G.

description: I walked by this place on the way to meeting nearby. It's super tiny and there was a lot of staff making the chocolates on site. The owner is friendly and energetic and the chocolate was ultra premium. I'll be stopping by again when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: H. H.

description: Socola has once again given me just what was needed for holiday gifts, special event and party favors, and business gifts.  I am lucky to have strong clients and special friends to remember and recognize at holiday time, and Socola chocolates are a great match of top quality plus unique, distinctive nature for a gift.  Truffle master Wendy and her team made  4 piece and 12 piece sets in various combinations that were a treat just to pick out.  They also could make and add a custom logo design to every piece (just a little advance planning).  Separately they made me a big batch of little party favor chocolate sets, which were super well received and elevated the level of the special occasion event.  For gifts I mixed up reliable favorites like dark chocolate with unusual surprises like raspberry champagne.  Also the pate de fruit (perfect fruit gels) have been appreciated by people as a break from chocolate.  (But who could have too much chocolate?) Thanks to Socola for being a top resource for gifts and treats.
author: Walter H.

description: I got few people together and visited Socola Chocolatier last week. Newly opened, clean, fresh feel. I loved that you can see the owners and others make chocolate right in the store. We shared a box of assorted chocolates and I got a latte. Everything tasted great. The sriracha was a tad strong flavored for a few people but I loved it. All in all a good spot. The chocolates are pretty expensive (2.50/- for each small piece) but that will keep me from gorging on them in bulk :)
author: Malvika J.

description: gaaaaaaaa!!!!! awesome strong coffee. yum.
author: Tiff ..

description: This adorable chocolate / coffee shop is great. We got the truffagato, chocolate croissant, and a box of assorted truffles. The truffagato (truffle plus espresso) was a delightfully rich, slightly bitter espresso drink . The croissant was very fresh and soft! The truffles... My fave so far is the jasmine tea truffle. All the truffles have a strong flavor, rather than a hint. Will definitely be back!
author: Jenny C.
